subject: This Week on Reliable Sources
body:
CNN.com










Coming up this Sunday on Reliable Sources: 

Dan Rather vs. CBS

Dan Rather's comments
this week that CBS had been "dumbing down and tarting up" the
news set off a war of words between Rather, CBS Chief
Executive, Les Moonves, and CBS Evening News' Executive
Producer, Rick Kaplan.	Are Rather's comments simply sexist
sour grapes towards the network who let him go, or does he have
some legitimate criticism of CBS?

Too Much Iraq
Coverage?

After a report by the Project for
Excellence in Journalism showed that Fox News was devoting far
less time to the Iraq war than rivals MSNBC or CNN, Bill
O'Reilly charged CNN and MSNBC with showing violence in Iraq
simply to make President Bush look bad.  He also took aim at
the authors of the report.  Is there such a thing as too much
Iraq coverage?	We'll analyze the charges.

CNN/YouTube Debates

With the Internet
becoming an integral part of the Presidential Campaign, CNN is
joining forces with YouTube to host the next Presidential
debates. We'll tell you how that will work. Also, "Obama Girl,"
is the latest sensation affecting the campaigns, in the new age
of viral video are candidates losing control of their images?

Plus, Democratic Strategist Bob Shrum has been
spinning the media for decades.  He opens up about why he may
not have always been honest with the press.  And Paris Hilton
claims she will start using her media spotlight for good
causes, should we believe her?

Join us this Sunday
and every Sunday at 10am ET / 7am PT for our critical look at
the media!
